notes: There are 3 clear entry point scripts named 'main.py' in different subdirectories (20251020/Classes, 20251021/singlescripts, 20251024), each implementing a Pygame-based game loop.

The 20251024/main.py appears to be the latest and most advanced, with structured input handling, profiling, minimap handling, controller support, and organized object-oriented code structure (Renderer, Profiler, etc).
The project structure appears to follow an iterative, date-stamped workflow, suggesting a process of active experimentation and refactoring over time.

Each stage (20251020, 20251021, 20251024) seems to have its own self-contained implementation, possibly not sharing much code between them aside from utility modules (camera.py, player.py, world.py, etc within their respective folders).
Non-main python scripts (Animation.py, camera.py, config.py, input_handler.py, etc) implement subsystems and utilities for game objects, input, rendering, profiling, and world logic.
Recommended edit targets are the latest main.py (20251024) and its corresponding modules for further development, as it is the most feature-complete.
